TestUtil v. 2.0 is released coinciding with Mother's Day.  So what 
is the=
 connection?  For those practitioner's of automated method 
testing =96 few=
er lines of custom unit test coding translate to 
(potentially) more time w=
ith the family =96 or specifically, Mom! :-)

Remind me, what is TestUtil?
=

TestUtil is a Java open source low-effort automated method testing 
strate=
gy and tool for verifying all matching accessor methods on 
mutable objects=
 with a single line of unit test code.  It is 
compatible with both in-cont=
ainer and outside-the-container 
strategies extending JUnit.

So, what's ne=
w with v. 2.0?

With thanks to Mark Levison ( 
http://dotnetjunkies.com/Web=
Log/mlevison/ ) for the idea and the 
ThoughtWorks guys for QDox ( http://q=
dox.codehaus.org ), TestUtil 
now conveniently excludes classes and methods=
 from verification with 
Javadoc tags.  (See release notes at 
http://sourc=
eforge.net/project/shownotes.php?
release_id=3D416640&group_id=3D130647 .)
=

And the hyperlinks are?

          http://gt=
cgroup.com/util

icle of 
usage during an undisclosed company application development projec=
t 
is at:
          http://gtcgroup.com/util/TestUtil.By.Example.html

back is always an encouragement,
